Description: A Nubian and a fellah, standing, one of them carrying dromedary saddlebags; in the distance to left palm and other trees, to right buildings and more trees; after Prisse D'Avennes; illustration to 'Oriental Album: Characters, Costumes, and Modes of Life in the Valley of the Nile', with text by James Augustus St John and illustration by E. Prisse [Prisse D'Avennes], London: James Madden, 1848 Lithograph with one tint-stone
Producer name: After: Achille Émile Théodore Prisse D'Avennes
Curator's comments: The 'Oriental Album' is in the Department of Prints and Drawings. The impression described here is a different state to the impression bound in the volume, which has minor variations in the image, such as the trees, and in the lettering, where a title is inscribed on the stone and the name of the publisher replaces that of the printer.
Bibliographic references: IFF / Inventaire du Fonds Français: Bibliothèque Nationale, Département des Estampes (72)
Associated names: Illustration to: James Augustus St John
Associated titles: Oriental Album: Characters, Costumes, and Modes of Life in the Valley of the Nile
